title: Green beauty in 2023 challenges are greenwashing, rising costs and transparency says The Green Chemist Consultancy - CosmeticsDesign-Europe.com
summary: Sustainability remains a top priority for the beauty industry, but addressing greenwashing is a major challenge. Green beauty certifications and scoring systems have proliferated, but harmonization is needed to reduce consumer confusion. Supply chain transparency and rising raw material costs present additional hurdles for manufacturers of green beauty products.

title: The fragrance of forests - Symrise
summary: Symrise is reusing crude sulfate turpentine (CST), a byproduct of paper production, as a raw material for its fragrance products. The company has developed a process to extract valuable scent molecules from CST, which was previously burned as a waste product. Symrise's innovation contributes to environmental sustainability by reducing waste and using renewable resources.
green_innovation: TRUE, because it contributes to environmental sustainability by reducing waste and using renewable resources.
business_innovation: TRUE, because it is a new process for extracting valuable scent molecules from CST, which differs significantly from the firm's previous processes.
green_product: TRUE, because it is a product (fragrance molecules) that is made from a renewable resource (CST) and has a lower environmental impact than traditional fragrance molecules.
green_process: TRUE, because it is a new process for extracting valuable scent molecules from CST that minimizes environmental impacts and promotes sustainability.

greenwashing: FALSE, because the article describes a genuine green innovation that is backed by scientific research and has been implemented in a responsible manner.

title: Discover the Top 10 Emission Reduction Technology Trends in 2023 - StartUs Insights
summary: This report covers the top 10 emission reduction technology trends shaping 2023 based on an analysis of 1680 startups and scale-ups. The trends include carbon offsetting, artificial intelligence, electrification, green hydrogen, carbon capture, utilization, and storage, energy-efficient integrations, big data, waste valorization, bio-based fuels and polymers, and emission monitoring.   Green innovations highlighted in the report include carbon offsetting solutions from Abatable and Tanso; AI-powered emission tracking from AI Shading and GAIA; electrification solutions from Zevx and Leaf Energy; green hydrogen solutions from Azolla and Faraday Fuels; and carbon capture solutions from Algiecel and Aqualung.   All of the innovations in the report contribute to reducing carbon emissions and promoting sustainability in various industries. However, the specific greenwashing status of each innovation is not discussed in the provided text.

title: Top 10 Best Agricultural Chemicals Companies In USA In 2023 - Inventiva
summary: Agricultural chemical companies in the USA are important for providing crop protection products and other inputs to farmers. These companies are expected to continue to grow and innovate in 2023, focusing on developing sustainable and effective solutions for farmers. The top 10 agricultural chemical companies in the USA in 2023 are Bayer Crop Science, Syngenta, Corteva Agriscience, BASF, FMC Corporation, Nufarm, Marrone Bio Innovations, Adama Agricultural Solutions, Agrolux, and Wilbur-Ellis Company.
